column4: Johnny nautilus is what displays the icons; when you run with --no-desktop there will be no icons
Johnny precisely. If you run nautilus  without --no-desktop, you get icons.
i had it set to use oxygen icons and now i dont know how
it went on top of awesome Blaqlight
i couldnt get to the terminal
Johnny I repeat: when nautilus draws the desktop, you get icons. Now, if you use some other desktop manager, that may be setting your icons
yeah, gnome-session starts a window manager and all
i just want to replace the folder icons in nautilus --no-desktop from the standard ones to the ones i had it set for
i had it just a second ago
Johnny oh, the icons <inside> of nautilus, not on the desktop
Johnny iirc, you can start gnome-settings-daemon but I'm not sure
is there an app to change the icons in my gtk icons in a light window manger
Johnny you can set an icon theme with gconf-editor /desktop/gnome/interface/icon_theme .
its already set to the theme i want Nick_
